intro: Pedicularis uralensis, commonly known as the Siberian lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and Siberia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to red, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Pedicularis uralensis is part of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species.
